bibl.title: A. C. Hallam v. Henry M. White. Amended Criminal Complaint
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Police Court, in and for the City of Bremerton
Before JAS. W. CARR, Police Judge.
ex rel City of Bremerton, Plaintiff

Before me, Jas. W. Carr, Police Judge in and for the City of Bremerton, in the County of Kitsap and State of Washington, A.D., 1920, personally appeared F. A. Watrous this 15th day of November,who, being first duly sworn on oath complains and says:

That at the City of Bremerton, in the County of Kitsap and State of Washington, on the 15th day of November, 1920, A. C. Hallam did commit a misdemeanor in this that he the said A. C. Hallam did then and there operate, conduct and maintain a public dance hall at the Navy Yard Hotel, a building then and there located on U.S. Government property, and then and there owned by the U.S. Government, and managed by the said A. C. Hallam, under lease with the Navy Department, of the U.S. Government, being within the City of Bremerton, without having then and there paid a license fee therefor, as provided by Ordinance No. 465, contrary to and in violation of the ordinances of the City of Bremerton in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the State of Washington,
Wherefore, said complainant prays that the said defendant A.C.Hallam may be arrested and dealt with according to law.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27th day of December, 1920
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Petition of A. C. Hallam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
